To calculate the final interest income item in the income statement, I need to sum up all the interest receivables transactions.

Looking through the data, I need to identify all transactions with type "Interest Receivables" and add up their amounts.

Let me go through all the interest receivable entries in chronological order:

1. Interest20240101001: 1068.00

Now I'll sum up all these values:
1068.00 + 925.60 + 925.60 + 925.60 + 925.60 + 925.60 + 925.60 + 925.60 + 747.60 + 747.60 + 747.60 + 747.60 + 747.60 + 747.60 + 747.60 + 569.60 + 569.60 + 569.60 + 480.60 + 480.60 + 368.23 + 368.23 + 242.90 + 242.90 + 242.90 + 153.90 + 153.90 + 153.90 + 153.90 + 153.90 + 64.90 + 64.90 + 145.78 + 137.04 + 44.60 + 34.28 = 18,380.35

Therefore, the total interest income is approximately 18,380.35.

However, since financial statements typically round to the nearest whole number or up to two decimal places, I'll round this amount to 18,380.35.
